paragraphs.content: Chapter 16
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 16

paragraphs.content: The preparations of the heart in man, and the answer of the tongue, is from the LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The preparations of the heart in man, and the answer of the tongue, is from the Lord.

paragraphs.content: All the ways of a man are clean in his own eyes; but the LORD weigheth the spirits.
paragraphs.contentHtml: All the ways of a man are clean in his own eyes; but the Lord weigheth the spirits.

paragraphs.content: Commit thy works unto the LORD, and thy thoughts shall be established.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Commit thy works unto the Lord, and thy thoughts shall be established.

paragraphs.content: The LORD hath made all things for himself: yea, even the wicked for the day of evil.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The Lord hath made all things for himself: yea, even the wicked for the day of evil.

paragraphs.content: Every one that is proud in heart is an abomination to the LORD: though hand join in hand, he shall not be unpunished.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Every one that is proud in heart is an abomination to the Lord: though hand join in hand, he shall not be unpunished.

paragraphs.content: By mercy and truth iniquity is purged: and by the fear of the LORD men depart from evil.
paragraphs.contentHtml: By mercy and truth iniquity is purged: and by the fear of the Lord men depart from evil.

paragraphs.content: When a man’s ways please the LORD, he maketh even his enemies to be at peace with him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: When a man’s ways please the Lord, he maketh even his enemies to be at peace with him.

paragraphs.content: Better is a little with righteousness than great revenues without right.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Better is a little with righteousness than great revenues without right.

paragraphs.content: A man’s heart deviseth his way: but the LORD directeth his steps.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A man’s heart deviseth his way: but the Lord directeth his steps.

paragraphs.content: A divine sentence is in the lips of the king: his mouth transgresseth not in judgment.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A divine sentence is in the lips of the king: his mouth transgresseth not in judgment.

paragraphs.content: A just weight and balance are the LORD’s: all the weights of the bag are his work.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A just weight and balance are the Lord’s: all the weights of the bag are his work.

paragraphs.content: It is an abomination to kings to commit wickedness: for the throne is established by righteousness.
paragraphs.contentHtml: It is an abomination to kings to commit wickedness: for the throne is established by righteousness.

paragraphs.content: Righteous lips are the delight of kings; and they love him that speaketh right.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Righteous lips are the delight of kings; and they love him that speaketh right.

paragraphs.content: The wrath of a king is as messengers of death: but a wise man will pacify it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The wrath of a king is as messengers of death: but a wise man will pacify it.

paragraphs.content: In the light of the king’s countenance is life; and his favour is as a cloud of the latter rain.
paragraphs.contentHtml: In the light of the king’s countenance is life; and his favour is as a cloud of the latter rain.

paragraphs.content: How much better is it to get wisdom than gold! and to get understanding rather to be chosen than silver!
paragraphs.contentHtml: How much better is it to get wisdom than gold! and to get understanding rather to be chosen than silver!

paragraphs.content: The highway of the upright is to depart from evil: he that keepeth his way preserveth his soul.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The highway of the upright is to depart from evil: he that keepeth his way preserveth his soul.

paragraphs.content: Pride goeth before destruction, and an haughty spirit before a fall.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Pride goeth before destruction, and an haughty spirit before a fall.

paragraphs.content: Better it is to be of an humble spirit with the lowly, than to divide the spoil with the proud.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Better it is to be of an humble spirit with the lowly, than to divide the spoil with the proud.

paragraphs.content: He that handleth a matter wisely shall find good: and whoso trusteth in the LORD, happy is he.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that handleth a matter wisely shall find good: and whoso trusteth in the Lord, happy is he.

paragraphs.content: The wise in heart shall be called prudent: and the sweetness of the lips increaseth learning.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The wise in heart shall be called prudent: and the sweetness of the lips increaseth learning.

paragraphs.content: Understanding is a wellspring of life unto him that hath it: but the instruction of fools is folly.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Understanding is a wellspring of life unto him that hath it: but the instruction of fools is folly.

paragraphs.content: The heart of the wise teacheth his mouth, and addeth learning to his lips.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The heart of the wise teacheth his mouth, and addeth learning to his lips.

paragraphs.content: Pleasant words are as an honeycomb, sweet to the soul, and health to the bones.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Pleasant words are as an honeycomb, sweet to the soul, and health to the bones.

paragraphs.content: There is a way that seemeth right unto a man, but the end thereof are the ways of death.
paragraphs.contentHtml: There is a way that seemeth right unto a man, but the end thereof are the ways of death.

paragraphs.content: He that laboureth laboureth for himself; for his mouth craveth it of him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that laboureth laboureth for himself; for his mouth craveth it of him.

paragraphs.content: An ungodly man diggeth up evil: and in his lips there is as a burning fire.
paragraphs.contentHtml: An ungodly man diggeth up evil: and in his lips there is as a burning fire.

paragraphs.content: A froward man soweth strife: and a whisperer separateth chief friends.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A froward man soweth strife: and a whisperer separateth chief friends.

paragraphs.content: A violent man enticeth his neighbour, and leadeth him into the way that is not good.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A violent man enticeth his neighbour, and leadeth him into the way that is not good.

paragraphs.content: He shutteth his eyes to devise froward things: moving his lips he bringeth evil to pass.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He shutteth his eyes to devise froward things: moving his lips he bringeth evil to pass.

paragraphs.content: The hoary head is a crown of glory, if it be found in the way of righteousness.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The hoary head is a crown of glory, if it be found in the way of righteousness.

paragraphs.content: He that is slow to anger is better than the mighty; and he that ruleth his spirit than he that taketh a city.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that is slow to anger is better than the mighty; and he that ruleth his spirit than he that taketh a city.

paragraphs.content: The lot is cast into the lap; but the whole disposing thereof is of the LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The lot is cast into the lap; but the whole disposing thereof is of the Lord.
